# textColor

**Instance Property**

The color of the text.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var textColor: UIColor? { get set }
```

## Discussion

This property applies to the entire text string. The default value for this property is a black color. The value for the property can only be set to a non-`nil` value; setting this property to `nil` raises an exception.

If you are using styled text, assigning a new value to this property causes the text color to be applied to the entire string in the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITextField/attributedText] property. If you want to apply the color to only a portion of the text, create a new attributed string with the desired style information and associate it with the text field.

## Configuring the text attributes

- **text**: The text that the text field displays.
- **attributedText**: The styled text that the text field displays.
- **placeholder**: The string that displays when there is no other text in the text field.
- **attributedPlaceholder**: The styled string that displays when there is no other text in the text field.
- **defaultTextAttributes**: The default attributes to apply to the text.
- **font**: The font of the text.
- **textAlignment**: The technique for aligning the text.
- **typingAttributes**: The attributes to apply to new text that the user enters.
- **UITextField.BorderStyle**: The type of border around the text field.
